website_summaries.verdict: An entry-level machine with many useful functions. The best deal for the lowest price.

customer_reviews.title: As recommended by Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Water compartment leaked. As recommended by Amazon, I called Singer at the number Amazon. I was told they no longer make this product and no longer support the product.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Nolte

customer_reviews.title: This is really good product. But i got a problem with that
customer_reviews.text: This is really good product. But i got a problem with that. There is something like grease or something like that on the pressing surface. Does anyone know how to get rid of that and fix it, please let me know if anyone knows how to fix it. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: amm

customer_reviews.title: Discontinued Cuz it doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't work and when I called Singer, they informed me it's been discontinued and no parts are available for it even while it's still under warranty. WHAT?
customer_reviews.author: Jack Neal

customer_reviews.title: Better than ironing, I guess
customer_reviews.text: Works good, but not great. I'm not sure if it is faster than ironing, but you can watch TV at the same time now. 6 month update: If you hang your clothes to dry instead of putting them in the dryer, this is not for you. You'll spend way more time trying to get those wrinkles out than ironing. And the pad under the cover stretched after a few months, leaving a nice line in everything you iron, and now it stretched and created a hole, while maintaining the ironing line.
customer_reviews.author: M. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Heat press works fine, but customer service is a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Heat press works fine, but customer service is a nightmare!! My heat press stopped heating a month and and half out of warranty. I called to get help and there is no one anywhere that knows anything about the part. Finally was able to get some help and gave me a part #. I then had to call another facility to order it. Waited a week for it and turns out it is the wrong part and now I can't return it. The heat press may work fine, but i will never buy a singer product again just because of the hassle of servicing it!
customer_reviews.author: Kathie

customer_reviews.title: Still trying to decide if I like this thing
customer_reviews.text: I got it to help fuse iron-on interfacing, but so far have been disappointed. I don't know if it's because of the steam function. It seems very spotty about where it fuses the interfacing -- also the fabric scrunches up, maybe it's shrinking a little as it is steaming. I wanted this to help me sew, but it is making more work for me. Can't find any good videos to show me how to use this for fusing iron-on interfacing. Anyone use a steam iron for this? (I'm using this because irons a lot of real estate at a time.)
customer_reviews.author: wonder time

customer_reviews.title: Holes Rusted
customer_reviews.text: i am extremely disappointed with this product. Used it 3 times and the holes rusted up. I cannot use it anymore and it looks like it cant be returned. Hoping to get some feedback from amazon about returning this product. Ive had it only for less than 2 months
customer_reviews.author: Karen Loizides

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed unit would not turn on
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed unit would not turn on. Water tank would leak all the water out. Got it to turn on once but no steam. Returned unit I will order it again hopefully this unit was just a fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Gerard

customer_reviews.title: Must have for avid sewist
customer_reviews.text: I gave four stars because the first one I received didn't heat up. The replacement has been working great. I do a lot of sewing and this works great for applying fusable interfacing to fabric. It heats up pretty quickly. It's great for pressing large items like table clothes and sheets, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kaori Ikeuchi-Feldman

customer_reviews.title: In general, helpful
customer_reviews.text: It surpassed my expectation. Lay the clothing on the flat surface, close the iron, and wait for the beep. However, be careful when maneuvering your garment around the steam press. In my opinion, the top of the press, especially the back of it, is too close, and I hit the hot surface with the back of my hand a couple of times. Also, the water reservoir is not removable. It is a ridiculous design flaw. In order to empty the water reservoir, the menu suggest pressing the steam button a couple of times, so waste electricity just to empty the reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: I_HATE_THIS

customer_reviews.title: Dead out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: Opened up the box, plugged it in to a working outlet. Turned on the switch on the back. Nothing. Dead out of the box! Spent a few minutes on with the chat so they could ask me if I powered it on, and pressed the buttons on top. No help. So I selected replacement. Now I get to wait another week and hope the replacement works.
customer_reviews.author: Prime customer

customer_reviews.title: Saving time and money with this Steam press.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and worth the amount paid. I've purchased this so I can save some money on the cost of sending my shirts to the cleaner. Once I got the hang of pressing my shirts using the tips on videos in youtube, it became easier and faster for me to press my shirts.
customer_reviews.author: H.N

customer_reviews.title: It is perfect for what we needed
customer_reviews.text: This is well worth the money! I purchased it to press my husbands uniform shirts because having it done at the dry cleaners adds up. It is perfect for what we needed. The only reason that I'm not giving it 5 stars is because its a little awkward to keep the shirts from falling to the floor when the press is opened. Other than that, I highly recommend it to anyone in law enforcement who has to have their shirts pressed. Its quick and simple and the steam feature works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rusts easily
customer_reviews.text: I am super disappointed. I have probably used this 10 times. I use distilled water only and I don't steam everything. But look how this has rusted on the edge. I tried to scrub it with my finger/fingernail before I used any other product on it and it did not feel like a residue. Also, I did have to watch several videos to master getting our clothes pressed without ugly creases in the item. I burn myself often when flattening and straightening cloths under the press.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Backhaus

customer_reviews.title: Better and faster hard-press
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use for hard-pressing my handwoven shawls and scarves. The larger flat surface and pressure worked very well. And it was much faster than my usual method of using an iron. The only drawback is that there is limited room at the back where it is hinged for the excess fabric. I carefully rolled up the excess as I proceeded, and this worked well for the shawls I pressed. The heating plate took a little while to reheat between presses, so sometimes I had to wait several extra seconds between presses.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: LIFESAVER!!! somehow my "wrinkle free" shirts became wrinkled. No matter how much I ironed them, the wrinkles would not release. I bought this...and the wrinkles came out. It even fixed wrinkled scrubs and work pants. SO glad I opted for this purchase, saved me a ton of money in replacements!
customer_reviews.author: Maddog

customer_reviews.title: save time and lots of money in the laundry.....
customer_reviews.text: A week ago i made my weekly trip to the laundry....this time i found an announcement ....by the door....due to increase of cost of operations, we regret to inform our clients that the price increase to 3.29 cents per shirt....well i had about 35 shirts that need to be press, since i do the laundry myself at home...that was the las drop in the bucket......i purchase this steampress .... i did my 35 shirts and 6 pants in an hour and half....not to bad....the quality of my work was about the same of the landry ...a little big of practice that’s all will take...i love it every minute.....
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Madrigal

customer_reviews.title: Best iron yet
customer_reviews.text: This is the bomb, very easy to use.. And setup. You will need to get a tie-down strap of some sort.. The one that comes with it is too short.
customer_reviews.author: tommy burns

customer_reviews.title: Great Iron Press from Singer as always
customer_reviews.text: Every 2 weeks I iron my shirts. I have learned many ways to use it and now my shirts are better ironed that dry cleaner company. The plastic label is losing the glue but who cares if the iron works great. The beep to alert when it is time to lift, helped me a lot. The little holes where water sprays leaves some mark on the shirts but its goes away. Distilled water should be used. Do not use other kind or your fabric will be brown or will looks burned. They should install the spray button some place else. Very easy to accidental push during up and down of the press.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Torres

customer_reviews.title: This one's a keeper!!!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of comparison shopping before buying this model. It was best in ratings, and it is well worth it! I sew a lot of bags and purses, and it saves me so much time when fusing interfacing to the bags. It just works!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol H.

customer_reviews.title: Singer ESP-2 works Magic
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my father a couple of months ago and, he loves it. He presses all his pants and shirts in sets of 6-8 items at a sitting. He has a generic stand for the Magic Steam Press, and keeps it in the kitchen until it's ready for use. The clothes come out pressed and looking nice, it's slight larger than the one he had before and is able to shave off a little bit of time versus the previous press
customer_reviews.author: Joe L.

customer_reviews.title: It would  be  perfect if the steamer didnt stop working
customer_reviews.text: I really like the press but like a number of people who purchased this item the steam function has stopped working. I just stopped working suddenly. Nonetheless I use spray starch and the bottom line is the machine makes easy work of ironing.
customer_reviews.author: Darren John-Baptiste

customer_reviews.title: Read reviews before you commit
customer_reviews.text: Sad. Beeped constantly, steamed and sputtered hot water all over. Was plastic y and didn't feel quality. This item had need repackaged and sold again to me which I knew, now I know why it was returned the first time. As always, prompt rte turn and credit from amazon. Item not my thing but love amazon service!
customer_reviews.author: A. Sweetman

customer_reviews.title: It did not work at all. Contacted customer support ...
customer_reviews.text: It did not work at all. Contacted customer support who where not able to fix the problem. Had to return it. Very unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Martha B. Poorbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long, got all rusty.
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this a lot, mostly for sewing projects so am extremely disappointed that it lasted only 12 months. I only use distilled water. and the top of the press is a rusty mess, I would hesitate to use it on clothing. Way too expensive to quit working after such a short period of time. Spend your money somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: MKM

customer_reviews.title: Not much protection for hands when moving item on pressing board.
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be a home-size version of commercial stam presses. But flat (rather than curved) pressing surface makes it useless for pants, shirts, etc. Fine for smaller linens & other flat items.
customer_reviews.author: Teachable

customer_reviews.title: I love this press it's compact and stores easily
customer_reviews.text: Singer just knows how to make an iron. I love this press it's compact and stores easily. The steam function is spot on, my only advice is do not use the recommended settings for each fabric I thought they were just to high. It took a bit of getting use to but buy the second day I was pressing king size bed sheets like a pro. I believe this is the latest model and am having some trouble finding the from replacement pad and silver cover I expect the older model ones would fit this but I'm holding out until they make them for this unit. Great buy as ironing time is much quicker, decently priced as well.
customer_reviews.author: GoogleFroogle

customer_reviews.text: Horrible!! I received the item and it will not work!!! After company, they gave me a serious run around and I still have a broke item and I'm out my money. Very upsetting!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rev Arthur Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit the stand recommended for it and apparently I missed the time frame ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not fit the stand recommended for it and apparently I missed the time frame to return it. When it steams it splotches. An iron would have been cheaper and easier.
customer_reviews.author: Purplebutterfly911

customer_reviews.title: Nice Ironing Method
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Recommend d buying stand with product. Steamer is great. Need to be larger device so you can really iron shirt and pants completely vs. having to remover clothing. Irons cloth faster than a regular iron.
customer_reviews.author: Dre

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great, great product. Clothes look great, much less stressful than ironing clothes with iron. I'd say reduces 75% effort if not more. I iron more often than I used to.
customer_reviews.author: Sameena Khan

customer_reviews.title: Nice and comfortable to work with
customer_reviews.text: I was having a problem with other irons at home, I had to press it on clothes and it was getting harder for me as aging. This one is working very well, the clothes get pressed without any effort. I will recommend this press to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: viqaralam

customer_reviews.title: Great Pant Press!!
customer_reviews.text: 1 - Runs SUPER hot - don't burn yourself! 2- Takes some getting used to - but after a few "newbie" runs, it works great 3 - DON'T run it on T-shirt graphics - turn it inside out or on the backside 4 - Worth the cash; I can zip out nicely pressed pants (jeans or dress) in about 2 minutes; professionally looking, also! 5 - Seems to be of great craftsmanship - most of it is metal construction (Not plastic) 6 - I don't use the "pad" much. Seems cumbersome. 7 - Use a tabletop or purchase the actual stand that it comes with - it won't go well on a regular ironing board (heavy, awkward)
customer_reviews.author: R. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I wish the pressing section was larger, but it definitely cuts down on ironing time!
customer_reviews.author: Mkiery

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how I survived without this. I'm so glad I made this purchase. I can iron pants in just two steps. It covers so much surface area. It heats up quickly. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: And the sheets look even better than being ironed
customer_reviews.text: We have a little casita we rent out on Airbnb and we iron the sheets for our guests. I should say my husband does. But not anymore. I bought this and he LOVES it. It has cut down the job by half. And the sheets look even better than being ironed.
customer_reviews.author: annie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing & Easy!
customer_reviews.text: I hate ironing, by hate I mean I DETEST IT from the pit of my soul. It's up there with doing dishes. I bought this for my mom for Christmas and I'm hooked. I used to throw clothes in the dryer to dewrinkle them, but now I know I must buy one of these for myself. There are videos on YouTube to accurately instruct you how to use this product. Well worth it. Keep an eye open for the videos right from foreign dry cleaners- they show tricks and speed methods so you can really get the full functioning quality of this baby.
customer_reviews.author: kriddlelynn

customer_reviews.title: It's very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing and is very easy to use. It's less work and irons clothes in a few minutes. But one of the problems that I have is that the delivery was too slow.
customer_reviews.author: Mingwenliu

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful appliance. I have a sturdy cart that is just right height. Love using it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rainey

customer_reviews.title: Great for uniforms as well.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a while back to press my uniform. Fantastic and easy to use. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Miyar

customer_reviews.title: I bought this 2 years ago. I messed up ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 2 years ago. I messed up the first time and forgot to put a towel over shirts with graphics so the imprint is embedded in it now. It works well. The only issue I have is the shoulder parts of dress shirts. Its very difficult to get all the lines out in that area. But besides that it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Squally Ollie

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this type of iron for a good 25 years. If I have to use the old standard iron, it won't happen. It took a while to get used to it, I will admit. I originally purchased it when my husband wore suits to work. We sent them to the cleaners when not really necessary but they were wrinkled. This puts in a beautiful crease. It paid for itself the first couple months. I even crease my jeans. Love it, Love it, Love it!
customer_reviews.author: LINDA

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Working with it not easy as presented in the video or instruction.
customer_reviews.author: HamidReza Taghavi

customer_reviews.title: Great item just buy an extra pad & cover.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this for a year! Everything I ironed looked like I just purchased the clothing item. However, I noticed the cloths weren’t coming out as well this past week. I needed a new pad. When I took off the old one the yellow padded cushion under the cover was burnt!
customer_reviews.author: DFarrell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and large steam table makes quick and ...
customer_reviews.text: Singer has paid for itself on savings from otherwise sending clothes to the cleaners. Easy to use and large steam table makes quick and effecient work of wrinkly clothes.
customer_reviews.author: CLOS

customer_reviews.title: Cuts time ironing slacks
customer_reviews.text: Too large for the house. Great for a laundry room
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The machine that paid  itself?
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can dry clean my clothes at home. T-shirts and Polos cost alot to dry clean and lets face it, they are clothes to hang out. Now I can press them, they look like they did in the store and I look great in jeans and T-shirts for the first time. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Gilberto Delgado

customer_reviews.title: He didn't use it at full temperature and it is still able to do a wonderFul job. He has not used it for his ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband was a member of the ceremonial guard and its new in the color guard. He used to spend an hour after work everyday getting his uniform ready and sometimes more than that. He is really impressed by the presser. He didn't use it at full temperature and it is still able to do a wonderFul job. He has not used it for his dress blues which are wool.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded all expectations
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product. It is compact and stowable yet large enough that it is not frustrating to use. I do not know what else to say other than it simply "works."
customer_reviews.author: DELAWARE 2018

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Had one in the past and loved it. Returned this one because I didn't need it but would recommend and would buy again
customer_reviews.author: YvieB

customer_reviews.title: Slowly damages
customer_reviews.text: The steamer stopped working after 11 months. The presser is hot enough. If the steamer worked I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.V

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas. He loves to iron and that's okay with me!!! He uses it nearly everyday ( just can't keep his hands off of it). What I absolutely love is that he will press my jeans and it holds the crease even after washing & drying. Looks just like they've come straight from the cleaners. I love that he loves this machine!
customer_reviews.author: June Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! My wife doesn't know how she made it without it. Makes pants so much easier to iron. Would recommend it to anyone who has to iron.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great for napkins and placemats
customer_reviews.text: I entertain a lot, and my napkins and placemats never look the same after the first washing. However, this press brought gave them that perfectly flat and smooth finish they had when I first got them. The steam's efficacy is hard to determine, but the included spray bottle is handy. A shirt is kind of hard to manage on this press, as are larger items, but despite this, the quality of the pressing kind of makes that deficiency o.k.
customer_reviews.author: HighRockHome

customer_reviews.title: Great Press!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this press iron for a short time but I've used it many times. Love the look & most importantly I'm very impressed. First press of a blouse didn't turn out half bad (I'll need to practice for sure.) I'm a quilter by profession and will be using this iron more for that than actually pressing clothes. Tried out a fusible project and it cut my work in 1/2...no more small irons to make huge quilts. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Peterman

customer_reviews.title: Steam Press for home
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this product! I have had it for a number of months now and it is great! It doesn't take the place of your iron......but it sure makes ironing time go faster if the item doesn't need intricate pressing, such as blingy or delicate blouses. I do press my bling jeans with this presser. It is wonderful if you like to press your sheets. The size of the steam press might be a bit small for some, but for me, it is a good size. i am very pleased with it!!
customer_reviews.author: Revival Doc

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am still trying to figure out how to use it. How can I make it work?
customer_reviews.author: Rose Mary Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great iron
customer_reviews.text: I love the different settings for the different fabrics. It saves you money on dry cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: NephtaB

customer_reviews.title: Got his for my husband for Christmas. He had ...
customer_reviews.text: Got his for my husband for Christmas. He had wanted one for a long time. He really likes and cut ironing time drastically.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Prince Raynor

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Was very excited to start using this steam pressing machine however was very disappointed that it did not even turn on the first time it was plugged in. It was returned today. Still disappointed and surprised that such a brand name does not have the QA/QC procedure in place before shipping to customers.
customer_reviews.author: S. Salhi

customer_reviews.title: Money saver..
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected, I will save money all year long on most of my pressed clothing that used to go to the cleaners.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I really love this and use it often. Its a great product and VERY safe to use. My only comment in the negative is that the water refill is precariously placed. I wish that was easier. But overall, 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: 99milesaway

customer_reviews.title: She tells me it works real good and she been getting good use out of it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the Mom and I got brownie points for it. She tells me it works real good and she been getting good use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: kwade

customer_reviews.title: Great even coverage with a nice wide ironing platform
customer_reviews.text: Great even coverage with a nice wide ironing platform. I use to heat treat synthetic hair, and after nearly 200 hours of use it's still working perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Seth Grasteit

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: Buyers beware, I purchase my second singer press and kept in box for 1 year. I press clothes for a living. When it came time to open it, the press did not work and when I went to get it fixed, I was informed that Singer did not make the part for it anymore. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great. It works better and fast than a house hold iron.
customer_reviews.author: trey

customer_reviews.title: Great press.
customer_reviews.text: The deck is a bit small but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie Key

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my wife as a gift, she ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife as a gift, she had a old!! One and it played out, she is all smiles,enough said
customer_reviews.author: CN

customer_reviews.title: It works great. You do need to use a overlay or ...
customer_reviews.text: What did I do without this machine before. It works great. You do need to use a overlay or a towel to put over your shirt because it is hot enough to actually bring the fabric
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: Poor condition
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product used and the condition of the product was poor. Rusted, stained fabric, very dirty. It was represented as very good condition which was not true
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Love it !!!
customer_reviews.text: What a time saver! I got it just for pressing my quilting pieces but have since folded up my ironing board and just just this. My husband evens has me iron his jeans but they are a vreeze. I respect the Singer name,
customer_reviews.author: sculpyfan

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: This steam press take hours from the weekly chores of ironing. The only set back is the cheap matted foam cover, it is not designed for the type of heat generated by the steam press. It also leaves creases on the clothing if not restretched after atrical of clothing ironed. Recommend discarding the cover and purchase a standard ironing board cover.
customer_reviews.author: Moufdi Louah

customer_reviews.title: Love my Magic Press Iron
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd one I have had, works great. I really hate to iron, the magic press cut my ironing time in half. The one I replaced I have had since 1998. When this one goes out I will buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M Griggs

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product for home-pressing when you have no time to get that pair of slacks or shirt to the cleaners and you need something pressed NOW. Easy to use and handy, my only gripe would be that it just seems oddly shaped to store in a handy place, but that isn't worth a star deduction. If you need it, you ought to spring for it.
customer_reviews.author: JordanJasper

customer_reviews.title: Very nice iron
customer_reviews.text: Takes some getting used to, but irons like crazy when when you're comfortable with it. Takes a little while to heat, maybe 2 minutes, and sometimes needs to heat backs up when going crazy with it, but for normal use, it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I even manage it with duvet covers.
customer_reviews.author: Winnie's Dad

customer_reviews.title: An improvement over a standard iron!
customer_reviews.text: Really cuts ironing time. Taking me a while to decompose the technique but I’m getting there. Well made.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: It is so easy to use.  You MUST read the directions.
customer_reviews.text: This presser is so easy to use. My pressing is done in less than 1 hour! Usually less than 45 minutes. I now use cloth napkins as it takes less than 15 seconds to press a napkin!!!!!!! Yippee!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol Brooksblindboy

customer_reviews.title: can you fall in love with a household appliance
customer_reviews.text: can you fall in love with a household appliance? i think i did! this is fantastic. i HATE to iron. i have a jiffy steamer that never seems to get the wrinkles out completely. i convinced my husband we needed this. i hate going to the dry cleaners for his shirts. i have been washing and hanging dry for a while but could never get the crisp look unless i ironed(which i have already mentioned i HATE!). i got this yesterday, put distilled water in it and literally almost cried when i finished the first shirt. i then proceeded to steam press almost everything in the house. thank god the dogs escaped::)) the possibilities are endless! just wow!!
customer_reviews.author: kandylandmo

customer_reviews.title: box came opened
customer_reviews.text: so i dont know what to think was it switched or not
customer_reviews.author: Judd Toshtig

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This product look quite solid and it's easy to use and does a great job. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sharif

customer_reviews.title: Love it !!
customer_reviews.text: The padding needs to be a little thicker but I purchased another pad and added it to existing pad and it works great , i love it , i iron everything and this is so much easier and adds a professional finish
customer_reviews.author: becky johnson

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like this steaner just wish it was a little longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy handle
customer_reviews.text: Came damaged, so not sure how it works but the handle is plastic and flimsy. The rest of the machine looked like it was quality made.
customer_reviews.author: Aekmap123

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product but I wish the pressing section was a little bigger
customer_reviews.author: Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: Great product . End result is comparable to taking your clothes to the cleaners .
customer_reviews.author: MYeamans

customer_reviews.title: Still working!
customer_reviews.text: Five star rating because this durable machine has not stopped doing what it does without problems. It was delivered in extreme packaging with easy instruction manual, water container and accessories. It's been a while since I have had it and I am still happy with my purchase. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Natural Peace

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Water reservoir is very cheaply built it’s very thin plastic and cracks easily I’ve barely had it two days and already broke
customer_reviews.author: TONY SCHOLLAR

customer_reviews.title: Great for pressing pants
customer_reviews.text: Great for pressing pants...not so great for a coat or a dress or anything with pleats. It's a nice compliment to an iron but not a substitute for one.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Quick Ironing
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this machine and have not used a held iron in ages. I sit on a raised chair and get all my ironing done is half the time and it is one terrific machine!!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia L. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I use this for applying interfacing to my sewing projects. I have to say, it cuts my prep time in half and improves the quality of my projects. Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This works so well and saves me so much time. I have a business and I am able to reduce my prep time thanks to this great item.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Its ok, not what I thought it would be ...
customer_reviews.text: Its ok, not what I thought it would be, When I press out my shirts I get wrinkles in one part which cause me to either redo several times to fix the issue or use an iron,
customer_reviews.author: pete

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last long enough
customer_reviews.text: We were happy at first, but it died 1 year and 4 months after purchase. Warranty is 1 year. We are a small household, so we don't use it too much. It really should have lasted longer. I'm buying a different brand to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: DrAB

customer_reviews.title: was not working upon umboxing and plugging in.
customer_reviews.text: Machine would not even turn on upon receipt of product. I read all the instuctions, even bought a heavy duty extention cord for plug in. Machine would not turn on at any outlets.
customer_reviews.author: lgtrucker

customer_reviews.title: product is mostly sufficient but could be made better for pressing fabric gets wrinkled because there is no ...
customer_reviews.text: product is mostly sufficient but could be made better for pressing fabric gets wrinkled because there is no opening in back for fabric to flow through
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Royston

customer_reviews.title: Not Working!!!
customer_reviews.text: Received the steam press, and it doesn't work... It does not heat and I just received it today...
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Bermudez

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I Love This Thing: Very easy to use; faster than using an iron;
customer_reviews.author: JohnC.

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: Second breakdown. First time after one week and now after 4 months of use. Seems to have a default on those steam press. When I press the steam button the unit shut down by itself.
customer_reviews.author: indie34

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, wish it had bigger pressing area
customer_reviews.text: It works wonderful. The description of the pressing area said it was 20 inches deep, but it is only 10 inches deep. I still like it.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Sherry

product_meta.title: SINGER | Magic ESP-2 Electronic Steam Portable with A Large Pressing Surface & Auto Shut-Off with Audible Alarm - Sewing Made Easy
product_meta.description:
Style Name:ESP-2

The SINGER Magic Steam Press gives you professional pressing results right at home. With a large pressing area and adjustable heat and steam settings, you can quickly press tablecloths, curtains, dress pants and more. This portable unit is easy to store and includes auto shut-off with an audible alarm for safety.

This SINGER ESP-2 Steam Press is a great time saver. You won't have to spend time and money at the cleaners to achieve that fresh pressed look. The portable steam press features a large work area and adjustable heat and steam settings. It comes with a pressing pad, spray bottle and refilling bottle. The SINGER ESP2 Magic Steam Press has a locking handle, making it easy to transport and store.

It is simple and convenient to use while producing professional-quality results.

PRODUCT DETAILS:
Brand: Singer
Model: ESP2
Weight: 22 pounds
MPN: ESP2
EAN: 0881110010475
UPC: 804067325447
Product Dimension: 25.8 x 21.2 x 8.2 inches
feature_bullets: SINGER ELECTRONIC STEAM PRESS: The SINGER Magic Steam Press gives you professional pressing results right at home. With a large pressing area and adjustable heat and steam settings you can quickly press tablecloths, curtains, dress pants and more
PORTABLE STEAM PRESS: This portable unit is easy to store and includes auto shut-off with an audible alarm for safety,24inches by 9inches pressing area, 14x larger than a conventional iron

STEAM PRESS ALARM: It has an Auto Shut-off with Electronic Alarm that sounds every 10 seconds if the handle is left down to remind you to lift the handle to ensure that fabrics are not exposed to the heating plate too long
EXTRA LARGE PRESSING SURFACE: The SINGER ESP-2 Electronic Steam Press is 10 times larger than the surface of a conventional iron
SINGER ESP-2 ACCESSORIES: Spray Bottle, Measuring Cup, Pressing Cushion
WARRANTY: The SINGER ESP-2 Electronic Steam Press with one-year limited warranty.
